metric_name: Market Value to Realised Value Ratio (MVRV)
description: Represents the ratio between Market Capitalisation and Realised Capitalisation. This serves as an indicator for whether the current price is overvalued or undervalued.

Unrealized Profit represents the total profit accumulated by UTXOs which were created (i.e. realized) when the price of the asset was lower than the current price. Relative Unrealised Profit is calculated by dividing the total gross unrealized profit of UTXOs by the Market Cap.

NUPL looks at the difference between Unrealized Profit and Unrealized Loss to determine whether the network as a whole is currently in a state of profit or loss. It is calculated by (Market Cap - Realised Cap)/Market Cap.

The net realized profit/loss for all coins spent over the timeframe considered. Values > 0 means that profits are being realized on-chain i.e. On average, price of coins spent > price when coins were created. Values < 0 means losses are being realized on-chain i.e. On average, price of coins spent < price when coins were created.
SOPR represents the aggregate realized profit or loss on a particular day. Values > 1 implies that coins moved that day are selling at a profit and vice versa for values < 1.

NVT represents the ratio between Market Capitalisation and transferred volume. An upward trend will indicate that the coin pricing is at a premium, whereby Market Capitalisation is growing at a pace greater than that of transferred volume. A downward trend will indicate that the coin pricing is at a discount, whereby Market Capitalisation is growing at a pace smaller than that of transferred volume. A constant trend will mean that both Market Capitalisation and transferred volume are in equlibrium.
Measure of how quickly units are circulating in the network. It is also the inverse of NVT ratio.
Thermocap is the aggregate amount of coins paid to miners. This ratio will indicate if the asset's price is currently trading at a premium relative to the total security spend by miners.
A measure of ecnomic activity which gives more weight to coins which have not been spent for a long time. E.g. A UTXO of 2BTC that is dormant for 100 days will have a CDD of 200 coin days.

Difference between Realized price and Transferred price. Transfer Price is the cumulative sum of Coin Days Destroyed in USD, adjusted by circulating supply and total time since Bitcoin's establishement. Balanced Priice attempts to detect major cycle bottoms.
The average number of days each spent coin had been dormant for before it was moved
The fraction of total transaction value over the total number of transactions for each day
Uses moving averages (MA) of Bitcoin mining difficulty i.e. difficulty in mining a block
